meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: One Storm Away: How Many Of The World's Great Cities Could Soon Be Underwater?

div.div: Are the world's major cities ready for the rising waters and freak storms of tomorrow?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rt7F6E&via=Digg&text=One Storm Away: How Many Of The World's Great Cities Could Soon Be Underwater?

div.a: Inside The London Flat That Was Transformed Into A Geode

div.div: Believe it or not, this crystalline cavern is actually a London apartment.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TsyGrD&via=Digg&text=Inside The London Flat That Was Transformed Into A Geode

div.a: China's Newest Stealth Fighter Takes Flight

div.div: If these pictures are real, then China has flown two new types of stealth fighters in less than two years. You're looking at what's supposedly the newly unveiled Shenyang Aircraft Corporation's J-31 jet flying in the skies over China.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tn8SbZ&via=Digg&text=China's Newest Stealth Fighter Takes Flight

div.div: GETTING IN IS THE HARDEST PART

div.a: How To Hack The Insane College Applications Process

div.div: When it was time for you to apply to college, was your high school guidance counselor helpful? Didn't think so. This new service offers an alternative.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ui0awP&via=Digg&text=How To Hack The Insane College Applications Process

div.a: The Man Who Predicted The Subway Disaster

div.div: The New York subway system, which maintains 468 stations and more than 600 miles of track, has an average weekday ridership of about 5 million people. Not one of them has been on a train since Sunday evening. Klaus Jacob is the man that saw it coming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PHqgxh&via=Digg&text=The Man Who Predicted The Subway Disaster

div.a: How The MTA Plans To Un-Flood The New York City Subway System

div.div: NYC has one of the most intricate mass transit systems in the world, supporting around 8 million people each day, but its dependence on decades-old pumps and an ill-prepared city drainage system makes it difficult to recover from disasters.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RunzvY&via=Digg&text=How The MTA Plans To Un-Flood The New York City Subway System

div.div: Oh sure, you know what it is … but do you really know what is going on? There is some interesting physics here.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RtxXUL&via=Digg&text=What Is Daylight-Saving Time?

div.div: GREAT, NOW SANDY IS RELEASING GHOSTS TOO

div.a: Skeletal Remains Found Under Tree Uprooted By Hurricane Sandy

div.div: A homeless woman made a spooky Halloween’s eve discovery on the Upper Green: bones from a centuries-old human body unearthed by a giant oak tree toppled by Superstorm Sandy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q5mDRF&via=Digg&text=Skeletal Remains Found Under Tree Uprooted By Hurricane Sandy

div.div: BASICALLY GLADOS AS AN ALARM CLOCK

div.a: Uniqlo Release Creepiest Cell Phone Alarm Of All Time

div.div: Uniqlo is forthcoming with its hybrid techno-fashion identity, but this still seems confusing: The retail company has released an alarm clock "make-over" for smart phones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RqTtHL&via=Digg&text=Uniqlo Release Creepiest Cell Phone Alarm Of All Time

div.a: The Final Hours Of The HMS Bounty

div.div: The tall ship began to die early Monday morning in the hurricane-ravaged waters off the North Carolina coast. One of the HMS Bounty’s generators failed. Water flooded everywhere. The 180-foot-long, three-masted tall ship was losing power and propulsion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S7Z5bt&via=Digg&text=The Final Hours Of The HMS Bounty

div.a: Meet The Gun That Tests Spacecraft To Destruction

div.div: This cannon, at Nasa Ames in Silicon Valley, California, was built in the mid-1960s for the Apollo Moon missions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SbMnrk&via=Digg&text=Meet The Gun That Tests Spacecraft To Destruction

div.a: Hurricane Sandy As Seen By Bikes

div.div: As Hurricane Sandy approached New York City and public transportation was suspended, most of the city hunkered down. However, not everyone was content to stay indoors.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TUErKM&via=Digg&text=Hurricane Sandy As Seen By Bikes

div.div: The most popular app in the Japanese App Store, Manga-Camera turns your life into a Japanese comic book. It's like Instagram on acid.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O6FLwT&via=Digg&text=Manga-Camera For iPhone

div.div: Hurricane Sandy was already a prolific killer by the time it ravaged the Jersey Shore, flooded New York's subway system, and turned Queens's scenic Breezy Point neighborhood into an ashen crater. Before making landfall in the United States, Sandy swept through the central Caribbean, directly hitting Jamaica and Cuba, and dropping more than 20 inches of rain on a country already well acquainted with the blunt force of nature: Haiti.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SlDRXL&via=Digg&text=The Other Hurricane Sandy

div.div: The first recorded cremation in Britain was in 1885. Mrs Jeanette Pickersgill was one of three people that year who were cremated, out of 596,000 deaths. But how common is the procedure today?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W6PJ5W&via=Digg&text=How Common Is Cremation?

div.a: Years Of Cancer Research Lost In Hurricane

div.div: New York University Hospital's Smilow building lost power, destroying many precious enzymes, antibodies and DNA. Thousands of mice used for cancer research and experiments drowned during a flood.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UfnuLv&via=Digg&text=Years Of Cancer Research Lost In Hurricane

div.div: Researchers find a simple way to make statements seem more true.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W6bUck&via=Digg&text=Can Politicians Manufacture 'Truthiness'?

div.div: The insurance industry will soon be shelling out big payments to cover the storm’s massive damage. And it says the U.S. is uniquely positioned to suffer from climate change.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SiONFF&via=Digg&text=How Much Will Sandy Cost?

div.a: A Deluge Of Powerstrip Porn As Sandy’s Victims Huddle Around Charging Stations

div.div: As New Yorkers stumble northward in search of working outlets, the whole city is seeing spontaneous outbreaks of cooperation. The geekiest example of which must be powerstrip sharing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W7mMXF&via=Digg&text=A Deluge Of Powerstrip Porn As Sandy’s Victims Huddle Around Charging Stations

div.div: It would seem that the social currency of homophobia is disappearing quickly. But lest you get too optimistic, a new site has the numbers in, and they don’t look great.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SsZ9Fy&via=Digg&text=Tracking Casual Homophobia

div.div: Pilots have been seeing unexplained things outside their cockpit windows since the dawn of aviation. But have these distractions ever caused an aerial accident?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkYpQh&via=Digg&text=Can UFOs Cause Air Accidents?

div.div: BUT YOU'LL NEED TO FIND A FRIEND FIRST

div.a: Take On Hoth With This Giant AT-AT Costume

div.div: Stkmach on Instructables wanted to do something big this year, and he succeeded. His 1:6.5 scale AT-AT takes two people to operate and measures over 10′ tall and 12′ long.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q759UZ&via=Digg&text=Take On Hoth With This Giant AT-AT Costume

div.div: THE MORE DIGITAL, THE LESS RELIABLE

div.a: The States With The Riskiest Voting Technology

div.div: Some states—including swing states—are more vulnerable to glitches that could tip the election. But the lack of a paper backup means such errors can go undetected.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ykzpfo&via=Digg&text=The States With The Riskiest Voting Technology

div.a: Awash In Cockroaches, Restaurant Calls Health Department On Itself

div.div: Usually, restaurants prefer to keep their infestation problems on the down-low, but one Marin restaurant is owning its massive cockroach problem. Not just any cockroaches, but German cockroaches.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SfD4HZ&via=Digg&text=Awash In Cockroaches, Restaurant Calls Health Department On Itself

div.div: WEREN'T A LOT OF US BACK IN THE DAY

div.a: How Many People Have Ever Been Born?

div.div: No matter how down you feel sometimes, take solace in the fact that you are one of the lucky 6.5% (or really a bit more, since this only goes through 2011) of people who are still alive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ShcttT&via=Digg&text=How Many People Have Ever Been Born?

div.div: The danger of falling for a machine that’s just not that into you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Udxrck&via=Digg&text=The Love Bot

div.div: If companionship and unquestionable love aren’t good enough reasons to adopt a new best friend, these pups show that taking in a shelter dog might even save your life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TUzSjz&via=Digg&text=7 Shelter Dogs That Saved Lives

div.div: I SPY WITH MY MIND'S EYE

div.a: Did Psychic Espionage Reveal A Spy?

div.div: An upcoming book claims that a spy was discovered through the use of psychic powers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T5ZpI1&via=Digg&text=Did Psychic Espionage Reveal A Spy?
